title: Scientists Investigate Potential Pathogens That Contributed to Napoleon’s Army Defeat in Russia

scene_plan.description: A wide shot of the snow-covered Russian landscape with a backdrop showing historical maps and timelines.
Close up on an open book detailing Napoleon's army size, followed by images of soldiers suffering from symptoms like fever and fatigue.

data_overlay.content: Hundreds of thousands perished during retreat
Researchers believe pathogens played a role in the demise.

voiceover.text: @lee627, calm and factual narration: 'In 1812, Napoleon's retreat from Russia was marked by a catastrophic loss of life. New research suggests that pathogens may have accelerated the soldiers’ decline.'
